channel.title: GTA IV enbseries help
channel.description:
for those of you who don't know, ENB series makes older games, some new, look better.
this particular mod allows you to use anti-aliasing in GTA IV. the only problem is that the config file that allows you to force stuff in the application is screwed up. [quote] [PROXY] EnableProxyLibrary=false InitProxyFunctions=true ProxyLibrary= [GLOBAL] AdditionalConfigFile=enbseries2.ini UseEffect=false [ENGINE] ForceDisplaySize=true ForceDisplayRefreshRate=false MaxAnisotropy=16 AntialiasingSampleCount=4 DisplayRefreshRateHz=60 DisplayWidth=1920 DisplayHeight=1200 [INPUT] KeyUseEffect=123 KeyCombination=16 KeyScreenshot=44 [REFLECTION] ReflectionPower=1.5 ChromePower=1.0 [BLOOM] BloomQuality=0 [/quote] when the AntialiasingSampleCount is set to 4, it takes the square root of 4, thats 2 and multiples the height and width of the resolution by it. instead of me running 4x anti aliasing at 1920 x 1200, im running 4x AA at 3840 x 2400.
if tried multiple configurations like 16x 480 x 300, but i get crashes at launch every time.
i have a EVGA GTX 285 2GB edition, so Vram isn't the issue. i can run everything fine, and then some. i just need a practical solution.
any help would be much appreciated.

item.title: GTA IV enbseries help
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
normaly it renders at double the Size of the screen and then resizes to your resolution.
it’s called downsampling

Read full topic

item.title: GTA IV enbseries help
item.dc:creator: Deutscher_Scharfschu
item.description:
for those of you who don’t know, ENB series makes older games, some new, look better.

this particular mod allows you to use anti-aliasing in GTA IV. the only problem is that the config file that allows you to force stuff in the application is screwed up.

[PROXY]
EnableProxyLibrary=false
InitProxyFunctions=true
ProxyLibrary=
[GLOBAL]
AdditionalConfigFile=enbseries2.ini
UseEffect=false
[ENGINE]
ForceDisplaySize=true
ForceDisplayRefreshRate=false
MaxAnisotropy=16
AntialiasingSampleCount=4
DisplayRefreshRateHz=60
DisplayWidth=1920
DisplayHeight=1200
[INPUT]
KeyUseEffect=123
KeyCombination=16
KeyScreenshot=44
[REFLECTION]
ReflectionPower=1.5
ChromePower=1.0
[BLOOM]
BloomQuality=0

when the AntialiasingSampleCount is set to 4, it takes the square root of 4, thats 2 and multiples the height and width of the resolution by it. instead of me running 4x anti aliasing at 1920 x 1200, im running 4x AA at 3840 x 2400.

if tried multiple configurations like 16x 480 x 300, but i get crashes at launch every time.

i have a EVGA GTX 285 2GB edition, so Vram isn’t the issue. i can run everything fine, and then some. i just need a practical solution.

any help would be much appreciated.

Read full topic
